isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER, GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - 9800 - SPEEDOMETER AND TACHOMETER DIAGNOSTICS - SPEEDOMETER AND TACHOMETER FAILURE ISOLATION

svcsubproc.title: Pass Indications
svcsubproc.para: The cluster will test itself each time the vehicle is powered up and indicate by pointer movement if the cluster is performing properly. The pointers should perform as follows:

item.para: The unit will drive both the speedometer and tachometer needles to the 9 o'clock position for about two seconds and return to the "0" position.
Both pointers will then advance through one complete smooth sweep and proceed back to the "0" position. This indicates that all output circuits are good and tells the driver that the gauges are good.

svcsubproc.title: Fail Indications
svcsubproc.para: The cluster will provide failure indications in two ways:

item.para: The speedometer and tachometer pointers do not move on power up.
The speedometer and tachometer pointers do not provide a proper gauge sweep or exhibit erratic pointer movement on power up.

svcsubproc.para: If either of the above failures occur, the speedometer/tachometer cluster will require further testing.
Conditions and corrective actions are defined in the TROUBLESHOOTING, Speedometer/Tachometer sections of this manual.
